title: Missing homing pigeon Bob found 4,000 miles away in Alabama
description: The bird was racing home to Gateshead but was found by a puzzled resident at his home in Alabama.

title: Cost of living: Families who care for relatives' children in crisis
description: Laura took in her two half-siblings six years ago, but says she is now struggling as prices soar.

title: Sri Lanka fuel crisis: Waiting for days to get fuel
description: Even taxi drivers and car salesmen are forced into two-day mile-long queues for petrol in Sri Lanka.

title: Life inside the Dutch earthquake zone
description: Homes damaged by gas extraction are propped up with wooden beams while residents suffer health issues.

title: Russia's elite 331st paras regiment fight for public support
description: In the thick of the Donbas battle, the paras regiment is trapped in a conflict that is costing many lives.

title: Assam: Death and despair after deadliest urban flood in India
description: Millions in India’s Assam state are struggling to piece together their lives after devastating floods.

title: A Nato summit in Madrid for hawks
description: The BBC's Frank Gardner speaks to Nato leaders during the first summit since Russia invaded Ukraine.

title: Ukraine round-up: Russia leaves Snake Island and Putin's topless G7 comments
description: A small but significant victory for Ukraine and Putin criticises G7 leaders' physiques - today's round-up.

title: Logan Mwangi: Juror traumatised by murder trial evidence
description: Dr Joselyn Sellen says hearing what happened to Logan Mwangi left her "completely traumatised".

title: Quiz of the week: What's Venus Williams doing at Wimbledon?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on over the past seven days?

title: Ukraine War: UK pledges an extra £1bn in military support
description: Boris Johnson, speaking at a Nato summit in Madrid, said freedom is "always worth paying for".

title: Snake Island: Why Russia couldn't hold on to strategic Black Sea outcrop
description: Russia claims it is a gesture of goodwill, but the withdrawal from a Black Sea rock is a big defeat.

title: Ecclestone says he'd 'take a bullet' for Putin
description: Formula 1 says comments by the sport's former boss Bernie Ecclestone on Vladimir Putin and racism are in "stark contrast" to "modern values".

title: Ukrainian troops getting weapons training in UK
description: The move to Western equipment is increasingly important as Ukraine runs low on Soviet-era arms.

title: Emma Raducanu says 'there's no pressure' after Wimbledon 2022 exit
description: Emma Raducanu says "there's no pressure" on her in the aftermath of her Wimbledon second-round exit against France's Caroline Garcia.

title: Kanye West sued over sample: 'There's a right and wrong way to do it'
description: "There is a right way and a wrong way to go about it," says musician Marshall Jefferson.

title: Abortion laws: The women jailed for suffering miscarriages
description: In El Salvador, a country with some of the world's harshest laws criminalising abortion, around 180 women have been prosecuted or jailed after losing their babies in pregnancy complications.

title: Theresa Jordan: Family's tribute after woman's body found
description: The death of Theresa Jordan, whose body was found in Harehills, remains unexplained, police say.

title: Inquiry begins into Captain Tom Foundation
description: The charity watchdog says it is concerned about the foundation's independence from a business connected to the family,

title: South Africa v Wales: Leicester flanker Tommy Reffell handed first Wales cap
description: Uncapped Leicester Tigers flanker Tommy Reffell will make his Wales debut against South Africa in Saturday's opening Test in Pretoria.

title: Former SNP MP Natalie McGarry jailed for embezzling £25,000
description: Natalie McGarry sentenced to two years for taking cash from the SNP and a pro-independence group.

title: Six police forces in England placed in special measures
description: Inspectors raised "systemic concerns" about the Metropolitan Police - one of six now under scrutiny.

title: Cameron Diaz to 'un-retire' from acting with Jamie Foxx film
description: The star officially quit making movies in 2018 but will now be re-united on-screen with Jamie Foxx.

title: LGBT in Ghana: 'We exist and we are here'
description: Angel Maxine, Ghana's first openly transgender musician, talks about the journey to becoming herself.

title: Breast cancer: 'I knew my body wasn't right'
description: A mother of three with aggressive breast cancer says she had 13 months of symptoms before diagnosis.

title: China's President Xi arrives in Hong Kong for handover anniversary
description: He says Hong Kong has "risen from the ashes" but critics accuse China of crushing the main freedoms.

title: Ghost broking: Young and vulnerable people targeted by insurance scam
description: There's a warning to "safeguard personal finances against fraud" amidst the cost of living crisis.

title: Yair Lapid: The ex-TV host set to be Israel's new PM
description: The 58-year-old former boxer and TV presenter will take the top office for the first time.

title: Australia v England: Courtney Lawes to captain tourists as Danny Care and Billy Vunipola return
description: Courtney Lawes will captain England in Saturday's first Test against Australia, as veterans Danny Care and Billy Vunipola also start.

title: Scottish independence: How will indyref2 compare to 2014?
description: The debate over Scotland's future has been scrambled by factors such as Brexit and the pandemic.

title: Cost of living: Are high school proms too expensive?
description: Pupils are skipping school as their families cannot afford expensive outfits and limos, charity warns.

title: A field of cows set me off on a new career path
description: Abby-Leigh Doig studied forensic psychology, but realised that she wanted to become a farmer.

title: The Papers: 'A new Iron Curtain' and '100m for the royals?'
description: More Nato troops in eastern Europe and a £15m rise in the Royal Family's grant feature in the papers.

title: Russia invasion: Putin still wants to take most of Ukraine - US
description: According to US intelligence assessments, Russia's invasion is likely to grind on for some time.

title: New map of ancient trees an opportunity for conservation
description: A new tree-map suggests there could be around two million unrecorded ancient trees in England.

title: Jan 6 hearings: Trump film-maker now has 'two armed guards'
description: Alex Holder, who filmed Trump after the 2020 election, has now been ordered to give evidence.

title: Russia's attack on Mariupol theatre a clear war crime, Amnesty says
description: Russian forces likely targeted the building knowing it was a shelter for civilians, the group says.
